intro: Hieracium chalicophilum, commonly known as the chalice-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium chalicophilum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed environments, making it a common sight in agricultural fields and along roadsides.
